Reviews.Title: “nice property/staff”
Reviews.Author: Krisha R
Reviews.Content: We have been staying at this property for 2 weeks and has been treated like stars. Place keep nice and clean and staff is wonderful. This is our 2nd time staying here and will be back...HIGHLY RECOMMENDED....

Reviews.Title: “Road Noise”
Reviews.Author: Larry M
Reviews.Content: Checked into room and road noise from Ventura road was so loud I couldn't sleep. Front desk changed my room. Then road noise from 101 freeway was loud. Hotel is located between Ventura Blvd & 101 Freeway. Lots of road noise. If you are a light sleeper this will not work for you.

Reviews.Title: “DO NOT STAY HERE!!”
Reviews.Author: Anton D
Reviews.Content: This place is the dirtiest hotel I have ever tried to stay in! They first gave me a smoking room when I requested a non-smoking room. After they switched rooms, the "Non-Smoking" room still smelled like smoke! The smoking rooms and non-smoking rooms are on the same floor so the smoke travels everywhere. The halls are smokey and the rooms are dark and very outdated. After 10 minutes in the room, I went to front desk and ask for a refund due to the smoke smell in all rooms. The staff was very nice and refunded my money. I left and went over to the Marriot and got a very nice room for a few bucks more in a completely non smoking hotel. If you like smokey, old, dirty hotels then this is the one for you...if not try the Marriot.

Reviews.Title: “Tired and Old; Not me, the Hotel.”
Reviews.Author: SandyBunker
Reviews.Content: The staff are friendly enough and do try hard to accommodate travelers, but do need to know which room numbers are on what side of the hotel. Our first room: Upon inspection, the kitchen cabinet over the sink was off the wall and resting on the counter - room uninhabitable. One would think this would be known to check in staff. So we had to change rooms. Our second room: Upon inspection we witnessed the air con unit was ripped out from the wall, and only the grate on the external wall of the building was all that was between us and the outdoors. Room uninhabitable. Requesting a room NOT facing the freeway caused confusion as the staff tried to calculate which room numbers that might be. Hmmmm. Anyway, finally room 3 was acceptable, on floor 2, mid building, and slightly facing the noisy 101. Furnishings were fine, mostly clean, old TV, modest appliances in kitchen, basic amenities in the bath, which was almost clean. The night was noisy with air cons heard above, below, beside us as well as traffic noise. The hotel needs attention, better basic maintenance, and clearer communication amongst staff. It is what it is; tired, old, and a cheap place to try to sleep. Not our first stay at ESA properties; our last at this one.

Reviews.Title: “Was an ok stay for one night”
Reviews.Author: RumRunner01
Reviews.Content: My husband had been staying here once a week for several weeks while attending the Art Institute in North Hollywood. He needed something economical and where he could fix some meals. This place fit the bill. I went down to LA with him in early December to attend an award ceremony for him and we stayed here. The location is ok, it's almost next door to a Denny's and down the street a couple blocks is a shopping center with grocery store. Parking was free and easy to find when we checked in. Our room was on the bottom floor and was quite spartan and seemed clean enough. You could tell furnishings were older and cheap but they were not falling apart. The bathroom was large and there was plenty of vanity space. The only amenity were bars of cheap soap. The shower was ok, the curtain will stick to you. Sometimes you had to flush the toilet twice. The kitchen area had microwave, fridge, sink, and range (I think). Kitchenware was sparse but enough for two people. The tv did not work properly, the cable was falling out and you had to wiggle it and the remote was all messed up and did not work properly. We had to control the tv with buttons on the tv. There is no closet, just a rod and shelf in the corner of the room. I'd say my biggest complaint was the bed, it was NOT comfortable and felt like sleeping on a piece of wood with a blanked laid over it. I did not have interaction with the staff but my husband said they were all nice enough. We did hear laundry going all night and that was somewhat annoying. We did have free wifi in the room. This place is just ok. I probably would not stay here again unless I absolutely had to.

Reviews.Title: “Home Away from Home”
Reviews.Author: bronxgirl42
Reviews.Content: From the moment I checked into the Woodland Hills Extended Stay America hotel, the warm reception and sincere response to all my needs exceeded my expectations. My room was clean, comfortable and provided the necessities for me to eat meals in the room should I so choose. Everyone at the front desk was professional and yet engagingly friendly. As a senior citizen who is "techie phobic", I was particularly impressed by the patience of JoeAnn from the reception desk, who, when confronted with my inability to access the wireless internet, performed her "magic" on my laptop and made sure that I was able to access the internet with ease. Although the room was cleaned twiced during my two week stay, the cleaning was thorough and all that needed to be done was done with care. Considering the price, the value was terrific. There are no comparable accommodations for the rate offered by this hotel. I've already made a return reservation.

Reviews.Title: “Grotesque and watch your back”
Reviews.Author: Cypresssea
Reviews.Content: The most dirty place I've ever been. No housekeeping even when requested and supposed to be weekly. I had to clean when I came in with disinfectant I had in car. Noisy. No linens. No toilet paper. No Kleenex. They said sorry you'll have to get them yourself. Don't expect to get straight story on rate at front desk.

Reviews.Title: “Not a family-friendly hotel”
Reviews.Author: LPamelaA
Reviews.Content: We set up my sister-in-law and her family here because she has 4 children and wanted a local place with a kitchenette. It was a disaster. One of the rooms smelled. The bathtub leaked and there was no staff to help clean up the water in the middle of the night. In fact, the one staff person available was rude about it and tried to blame my family. To top it off, the clientele at this hotel was sketchy at best. While waiting in the lobby at night (to get the water leak repaired), we witnessed prostitutes and their clients heading to rooms. This is not a hotel for a family.

Reviews.Title: “Worst, Filthiest Rat-Hole-don't Stay Here”
Reviews.Author: CactusCookie
Reviews.Content: Do not stay here unless you like filthy grounds & walkways covered with dog poop, trash, half-eaten take-out food spilling out of the containers, flies, cigarette burns on counters in the bathroom, missing kitchen utensils, dirty kitchen sinks, no toaster, in kitchen, noisy freaks in the next room who play loud music all night long until morning, and NO SECURITY STAFF on the premises overnight. The front lawn, was also covered with dog poop and anytime you walked onto the property, you had better make sure you watch the ground as you walk! Numerous complaints to the front desk regarding the trash and dog poop not being cleaned up or removed, were answered with the "alibi" that they were "in the process of hiring a new groundskeeper" but in my opinion, just a "baloney" excuse for not spending money to keep the place clean. Because of this bad experience I will NEVER, EVER stay at any "Extended Stay" hotel again, and I don't care where it is located. My trip to Woodland Hills, CA was to be three weeks long, but after several days of trying to deal with this messy place, I moved out and stayed at another, CLEANER place! AVOID THIS HOTEL! I will mention some good points to this hotel: The parking lot is huge--and there is always a place to park. The layout of the room is quite nice, and pleasant. But--as I stated, the negative points far out-weigh the positive. In my opinion, if there was a more caring, and smarter management running the place, it could have been an outstanding place to stay----But, it's not!

Reviews.Title: “Extended Stay was a mess”
Reviews.Author: portlandtraveler_8
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for six nights and over the course of our stay we had: fleas in our room, dog poop on the hallway carpet, vomit in the elevator, broken windows in our room, hallways that reeked of pot, dirty dishes in the cupboard and water running from the room upstairs into our room. I would not recommend staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Nightmare at the Hotel Hell!”
Reviews.Author: ItzHelloKitty
Reviews.Content: I was very dissatisfied with my stay at the Woodland Hills, CA location. I had to change rooms 2 times. The 1st room had ants all over the counterop, refrigerator & even the bathroom. The toilet was dirty & the room smelled foul. The 2nd room was even worse, and the room door could be opened without a key. All one had to do was push the door. But the worst thing was finding a used syringe in the dresser drawer! Finally, the 3rd room was somewhat habitable. Still dirty, ants, & the tub was backup up & would not drain. Although the front desk was friendly & provided room cleaning service for the duration of my stay, it did not make up for the inconvenience. I was there for 8 nights. I feel I should have received a room discount at the very least. That was my first stay at an Extended Stay America. I don't know that I would stay at any other facility. But, I know I will never stay at the Woodland Hills Extended Stay.

Reviews.Title: “From Bad to Worse to Awful”
Reviews.Author: chamberlainchild
Reviews.Content: The trash & debris in the parking lot were first clues of how really tacky this motel really was. It got worse. After unpacking I tried to close the window which wouldn't shut & it was ground floor. The desk clerk was unable to close it & moved me to another room. Next room had no clock, no remote control for the tv & cigarette holes in the pillow cases & sheets. What an improvement. Morning time 9am -- no coffee at the front desk, hmm. That evening no hot water. Waited an hour, no hot water. Called front desk -- closed & no emergency number. 8 am NO WATER AT ALL and no coffee at front desk -- GRRR. Finally had LUKEwarm water at 8:30 am & took a shower, then flushed toilet. YUCK! Toilet spit all over me from having had water off. Yet another LUKEwarm shower. Offered a buy one get one free night on my next stay. I think I'll PASS & report the deficiencies instead. Same management as Northridge so buyer beware! Should rename this MOTEL HELL.

Reviews.Title: “Recommend - Good Stay for a Good Price!”
Reviews.Author: ladyd088
Reviews.Content: Needed a place to stay while my dog and I were moving to Colorado. Prices were great adn the hotel was not as bad as I originally thought. Great kitchen (has silverware and pots n pans for use) and the area was great for walking my dog. Overall, I enjoyed my stay and would stay there again!! Recommend if you don't care about all the amenities of a normal Hotel Chain!

Reviews.Title: “Relocating to California--needed temporary housing”
Reviews.Author: FreuqentTraveler
Reviews.Content: I am a frequent traveler and my husband is not. He is much more tolerable then I concerning accomdations and not as picky. We are relocating to California and had booked him here for a month. After our first night we checked out. He could not stay here for a month. When we checked in we went to the room. Accomodations were not what we expected and the property was not well maintained. Very disappointed. Will not consider this again.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely No Service”
Reviews.Author: Cmonaco
Reviews.Content: Room was clean enough for a hotel room. Only problem we had in our room was when someone took a shower there was this loud nosie ..and i mean loud, enough for me to have to leave the room. But the worst part of the hotel was the service this hotel provides. I should say lack of. When you check in they give you a little card stating what they would provide "with just a call" to the front desk. We had just got in from a long trip and were staying in the first night so we called to get one of those extra pillows stated on the card. Only to be told they didnt have any pillows..lol. (i still find that funny for some reason) Anyway, there is no service and i mean none. Clean your own room , take out your own trash, and go to the front desk at just the right time for clean towels or they wont have any of those either. So to sum it up..If you want a room to lay your head at night and cant really afford anything else..it works. We didnt spend any time in the room except to sleep anyway. But if your expecting any kind of service ....go elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Service and Quality”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Had a great stay. The staff is helpful and resourseful. Definately would recommend this hotel to any traveler, not just long term.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Extendedstay Woodland Hills”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Fantastic place. It was such a great deal compared to the overpriced hotels in the area. I stayed last year and it was o.k., but this year the service was fantastic and the property looked brand new. This was a great stay for a week. Thanks extendedstay.

HotelInfo.Name: Extended Stay America Los Angeles / Woodland Hills
HotelInfo.Address: 20205 Ventura Boulevard, Los Angeles, CA 91364
